newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt to sell shares in six engineering firms.
newsitem.headline: Egypt to sell shares in six engineering firms.

text.p: The Egyptian state has decided to sell shares in six engineering companies through a stock exchange flotation starting this quarter, the government newspaper al-Ahram said on Tuesday.

The companies are Delta Industrial (IDEAL), Egyptian Electro Cables, Koldair/Nasr Engineering and Refrigeration, Transport and Engineering/Trenco, Egyptian Copper Works and Yayat/Springs and Transport Needs Manufacturing, it said, quoting Public Enterprise Minister Atef Obeid.
Obeid said he expected the six privatisations to raise 1.3 billion pounds ($380 million) but the newspaper did not say what proportion of the firms' equity the state would sell.
All six companies are subsidisiaries of the state holding firm Engineering Industries Company.
The holding company floated 20 percent of the shares in Egyptian Electro Cables in 1995 in one of the first privatisations through the stock exchange.
It has tried but failed to make deals with anchor investors for Delta Industrial and Yayat.
Cairo brokers tend to treat preliminary privatisation announcements by the Public Enterprise Ministry with caution.
